title: CopyJudge: Automated Copyright Infringement Identification and Mitigation in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
author: Shunchang Liu (EPFL, Switzerland), Zhuan Shi (EPFL, Switzerland), Lingjuan Lyu (Sony AI), Yaochu Jin (Westlake University, China), Boi Faltings (EPFL, Switzerland)
relevance_why: This paper discusses automated methods for identifying and mitigating copyright infringements in generated images, which could lead to similar techniques being applied in audio and speech realms for preserving intellectual property.
background: The paper tackles the task of identifying whether AI-generated images infringe copyright by comparing them with known copyrighted works using a systematic approach.
contribution: This paper introduces the CopyJudge framework to automate copyright infringement evaluation and mitigation strategies for text-to-image diffusion models, achieving robust detection and content preservation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often rely on distance metrics or fixed similarity measures that do not align well with human judgment.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages large vision-language models in a multi-agent debate format to achieve a more reliable and interpretable identification process.

key_innovation: The integration of a multi-LVLM debate mechanism allows for a more comprehensive assessment of copyright infringement by comparing multiple perspectives rather than relying on singular metrics.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework has the potential to significantly improve the way intellectual property considerations are handled in the realm of AI-generated art, promoting innovation while respecting creators' rights.
limitations: The current effectiveness is constrained by the availability of labeled data for training and validating the framework.

new_terms.large vision-language models: **Large vision-language models** are AI models that integrate visual information and language processing to understand and generate content across both domains.
new_terms.multi-agent debate: **Multi-agent debate** refers to a system where multiple AI agents discuss and assess information collaboratively to reach more accurate conclusions.
